str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To raise, lift up. From epi and airo; to raise up.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; an 'hour'.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To come, go.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To glorify, honor, bestow glory on. From doxa; to render glorious.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.

str2: To glorify, honor, bestow glory on. From doxa; to render glorious.

str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
